main event: Three lights forming an equilateral triangle were observed 30 miles east of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on 25 September 1955.
interesting points: The lights were described as being bright red and flashing.; The size of the lights could be covered by a silver dollar held at arm's length.; The objects had the ability to hover and appeared to follow a predetermined flight path.; The estimated diameter of the formation was about 100 feet.; The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes and was observed by a civilian.
sighted object: three lights forming an equilateral triangle
